French PM presents deficit targets slightly below predecessor's
subhead: Sébastien Lecorny aims to reduce the deficit by 0.7 percentage points of GDP in 2026, only marginally less than François Bayrou's plan. He rejected two key measures demanded by the left, and remained vague about the measures he will put forward.

title: Gaza: Diplomats press Trump to push Israel toward ending war
subhead: The American president floated a possible 'deal' to free Israeli hostages and bring peace to Gaza. Behind the scenes, several countries pressed him to take a tougher stance with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: 'Put Your Soul on Your Hand and Walk,' a cinematic memorial to Palestinian photographer Fatma Hassona
subhead: In this powerful documentary, Sepideh Farsi reveals her phone exchanges with the young woman who documented daily life in Gaza before her death on April 16, the victim of an Israeli attack.

title: Is America still a dream destination for French artists?
subhead: Since Donald Trump was elected, several musicians have canceled their US tours. However, in France, artists have refused to sever ties, mixing solidarity and pragmatism toward a market that remains all-powerful.

subhead: Nicolas Sarkozy will become the first former president of the French Republic to sleep behind bars after being convicted of criminal conspiracy, in the case of alleged Libyan financing of his 2007 presidential campaign.

title: Nuclear fusion: The race among start-ups to harness limitless, clean energy
subhead: Who will be the first to feed fusion power into the grid? From Germany to China, the United States to France, more than 50 start-ups are locked in a fierce race to control this long-sought energy source.
